website_summaries.verdict: WiFi-enabled light switch responds to light touch and offers the ultimate control of your home in tandem with Amazon Alexa.
pros: Modern design looks good in any room
Installation is simple and the smartphone app is easy to use
LED light on unit is helpful when trying to find switch in the dark
cons: No option to schedule lighting by specific days of week, only time of day

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design / Unreliable Junk
customer_reviews.text: The 2 plastic "bumps" at the top and bottom of the product won't allow this to fit into a standard junction box! I had to use a drill to melt 4 indentations in the juntion box to get it to fit. So what should've been a 10 minute project turned into an hour and 10 minutes. Who designs these things? Update - after 4 months of use the switch stays on for 5 minutes and then mysteriously yurns itself off. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M Reed

customer_reviews.title: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY. THEY STOP WORKING.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these switches. All three have completely died. First they wouldn’t respond by touch (had to use the app or Alexa to turn on/off). Did a complete reset (as advised) which worked for a while. Now. They don’t stay on. You turn on the light. 30 seconds to 2 minutes later it turns itself off. Hard reset again. Nothing. Took them out of the wall and went back to my old switches. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit a standard electrical box.
customer_reviews.text: I like this device. Problem is it does not fit a standard electrical box. The switch has (what I call) Mickey Mouse ears on its four corners for screws. I had to drill away parts of the electrical box to allow the switch to fit flush with the wall. Work I did not plan on doing. Other switches like this fit (6 others). Another problem was an Amazon problem. They GUARANTEED to deliver my order by Jan 5...it arrived on Jan 8. They said the product would arrive by 8 pm. After 8 pm they changed their message to “We don’t know where your order is, if it does not arrive by Wed, call us”.
customer_reviews.author: Home cook

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this light switch so that I could control my front porch lights remotely. I have Wink and Alexa. Although this switch does not work with Wink, it does work with Alexa which is perfect. Through the Oittm app, I can set a schedule for the lights to turn on at dusk and turn off at dawn. And no matter where I am at in the house, I can ask Alex to turn them on or off remotely. My first switch worked great, however the ring or circle never lit up. I informed the seller and they promptly sent out a replacement. I especially like the blue glow from the switch. It definitely "smarts" up the house.
customer_reviews.author: Erich Cervantez

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT buy these if you have the newer style "old work" single gang boxes in your home. And/or make sure you measure yours BEFORE you purchase these. They WILL NOT fit! This is absolutely ridiculous! The "old work" single gang boxes are 3" in height and these switches are 3-1/8" and they won't fit! I've been shopping online and in various stores to find a taller gang box but unfortunately nobody has any. What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Glad we have this in the bedroom.
customer_reviews.text: I set this switch up for our overhead bedroom light. The wall switch is pretty far from the bed and usually one of us (me) has to switch the light off and stumble to bed. It is great being able to switch the lights on & off using Alexa voice commands after we are in bed. No one has hot their shin on the end of the bed all week! Installation was straight forward. Nothing different really than replacing a typical switch or installing a dimmer. I like the switch being lit. It puts off a nice glow without being too bright.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works with my Google Home with the Smart Life app
customer_reviews.text: Everything was pretty self explanatory during installation. Like everyone else says, you need a neutral wire to make sure it gets power. Set up was easy with the Smart Life app which connects to my Google Home account. That way I can control the switch with my voice with my Google Home device. The only downside is that it didn't quite fit in my electric box, so it sticks out a little bit, but that's because the person who installed my box decided to use an extra small one for some reason. Not the fault of the switch itself.
customer_reviews.author: J. San

customer_reviews.title: Works great at first then quits
customer_reviews.text: I constantly have to delete these devices and reset them up. They're so inconsistent. I am in the process of replacing all of them. Just remember, you get what you pay for. The seller had to replace two of them. I now know why these were inexpensive. Maybe CHEAP is a better word. I would say don't buy unless you don't mind having to maintain them constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly—bought two more.
customer_reviews.text: Switch works well with one frustrating exception. The timer does not adjust for daylight saving time. Twice a year, I have to adjust all my timers by one hour. Tried deleting and reinstalling the app, no success. Why can’t they fix this? Would be 5 stars if they did. ***update to 5 stars*** I figured out the DST issue. On the home page, under profile, there is a place to set the time zone. Once I set this, it did adjust for DST. How it worked at all before I set this, I don’t know. But works fine now. Could deduct 1/2 star for poor instructions but the product does work fine.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD K

customer_reviews.title: Smart Switch + IFTTT + Alexa (requires neutral wire)
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Less than two years later, the touch-responsive switch has stopped responding. The switch still connects to wifi and is controllable using smart home tools, but the physical switch is non-responsive. Used this to 'smartify' our front porch light. Install and setup was pretty straightforward, but *you must have a neutral wire* available in the box. We set this up with IFTTT to turn on at sunset and off at sunrise. In addition, we can use Amazon Alexa to turn the Porch Light on and off (like for the pizza delivery guy).

customer_reviews.title: Works with no ground, wiring should not be a problem
customer_reviews.text: Update: switch died after a little over a year. It was a little hard to set up, but I think that was because it was too far from the router. Once it was on the network it was great. The app is pretty easy to use and enabling the Alexa skill was very straight forward. A lot of people seem to be worried about having it work without a neutral. I have an older home with old wiring and it is no issue. The switch doesn't require a ground to operate, so it should be possible to run in any normal situation (not a 3 way or 4 way switch).

customer_reviews.title: Install was easy, set up is a piece of cake
customer_reviews.text: Install was easy, set up is a piece of cake. We installed 6 on Christmas Day 2017. By the beginning of February we started having problems with 2. They turn off on their own at random intervals and the WiFi light goes out. We’ve checked the internet and also been told by the oittm app that their connection is good, we’ve told the app to forget the switches and reinstalled them, we’ve even reset both switches to factory default and gone through the entire set up process from the start. They are not overheating, we checked that too. It keeps happening. The other 4 switches still work great, but these two are driving us crazy.
